verses.text_plain: The burden of the word of the Lord to Israel by Malachi.
verses.verse_html:
1The burden of the word of the Lord to Israel by Malachi. ▼
▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of

verses.text_plain: I have loved you, saith the Lord. Yet ye say, Wherein hast thou loved us? Was not Esau Jacob’s brother? saith the Lord: yet I loved Jacob,
verses.verse_html: 2I have loved you, saith the Lord. Yet ye say, Wherein hast thou loved us? Was not Esau Jacob’s brother? saith the Lord: yet I loved Jacob,

verses.text_plain: And I hated Esau, and laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.
verses.verse_html: 3And I hated Esau, and laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.

verses.text_plain: Whereas Edom saith, We are impoverished, but we will return and build the desolate places; thus saith the Lord of hosts, They shall build, but I will throw down; and they shall call them, The border of wickedness, and, The people against whom the Lord hath indignation for ever.
verses.verse_html: 4Whereas Edom saith, We are impoverished, but we will return and build the desolate places; thus saith the Lord of hosts, They shall build, but I will throw down; and they shall call them, The border of wickedness, and, The people against whom the Lord hath indignation for ever.

verses.text_plain: And your eyes shall see, and ye shall say, The Lord will be magnified from the border of Israel.
verses.verse_html:
5And your eyes shall see, and ye shall say, The Lord will be magnified from the border of Israel. ▼
▼ from: or, upon: Heb. from upon

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from: or, upon: Heb. from upon
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from: or, upon: Heb. from upon

verses.text_plain: A son honoureth his father, and a servant his master: if then I be a father, where is mine honour? and if I be a master, where is my fear? saith the Lord of hosts unto you, O priests, that despise my name. And ye say, Wherein have we despised thy name?
verses.verse_html: 6A son honoureth his father, and a servant his master: if then I be a father, where is mine honour? and if I be a master, where is my fear? saith the Lord of hosts unto you, O priests, that despise my name. And ye say, Wherein have we despised thy name?

verses.text_plain: Ye offer polluted bread upon mine altar; and ye say, Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of the Lord is contemptible.
verses.verse_html:
7Ye offer polluted bread upon mine altar; and ye say, Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of the Lord is contemptible. ▼
▼ offer…: or, bring unto, etc

footnotes.body_html: ▼ offer…: or, bring unto, etc

verses.text_plain: And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil? and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil? offer it now unto thy governor; will he be pleased with thee, or accept thy person? saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
8And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil? and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil? offer it now unto thy governor; will he be pleased with thee, or accept thy person? saith the Lord of hosts. ▼
▼ for: Heb. to

verses.text_plain: And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: this hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
9And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: this hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the Lord of hosts. ▼
▼ God: Heb. the face of God
 , ▼
▼ by…: Heb. from your hand

tokens.text: And now, I pray you, beseech
unto us: this hath been by your means

footnotes.body_text: ▼ God: Heb. the face of God
footnotes.body_html: ▼ God: Heb. the face of God
▼ by…: Heb. from your hand

verses.text_plain: Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do ye kindle fire on mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you, saith the Lord of hosts, neither will I accept an offering at your hand.
verses.verse_html: 10Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do ye kindle fire on mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you, saith the Lord of hosts, neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

tokens.text: even among you that would shut

verses.text_plain: For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same my name shall be great among the Gentiles; and in every place incense shall be offered unto my name, and a pure offering: for my name shall be great among the heathen, saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 11For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same my name shall be great among the Gentiles; and in every place incense shall be offered unto my name, and a pure offering: for my name shall be great among the heathen, saith the Lord of hosts.

verses.text_plain: But ye have profaned it, in that ye say, The table of the Lord is polluted; and the fruit thereof, even his meat, is contemptible.
verses.verse_html: 12But ye have profaned it, in that ye say, The table of the Lord is polluted; and the fruit thereof, even his meat, is contemptible.

verses.text_plain: Ye said also, Behold, what a weariness is it! and ye have snuffed at it, saith the Lord of hosts; and ye brought that which was torn, and the lame, and the sick; thus ye brought an offering: should I accept this of your hand? saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
13Ye said also, Behold, what a weariness is it! and ye have snuffed at it, saith the Lord of hosts; and ye brought that which was torn, and the lame, and the sick; thus ye brought an offering: should I accept this of your hand? saith the Lord. ▼
▼ and ye have…: or, whereas ye might have blown it away

footnotes.body_text: ▼ and ye have…: or, whereas ye might have blown it away
footnotes.body_html: ▼ and ye have…: or, whereas ye might have blown it away

verses.text_plain: But cursed be the deceiver, which hath in his flock a male, and voweth, and sacrificeth unto the Lord a corrupt thing: for I am a great King, saith the Lord of hosts, and my name is dreadful among the heathen.
verses.verse_html:
14But cursed be the deceiver, which hath in his flock a male, and voweth, and sacrificeth unto the Lord a corrupt thing: for I am a great King, saith the Lord of hosts, and my name is dreadful among the heathen. ▼
▼ which…: Heb. in whose flock is

footnotes.body_text: ▼ which…: Heb. in whose flock is
footnotes.body_html: ▼ which…: Heb. in whose flock is
